website_summaries.verdict: A simple yet effective pulse oximeter that's available at a reasonable price.
pros: Lightweight unit that you can easily tuck in your pocket or purse
Comes at an affordable price point
Straightforward to use, plus the vivid screen is easy to read
cons: Requires three AAA batteries that don't come with it

customer_reviews.title: Work Well - Did not expect to make extra trip to get the battery to operate it.
customer_reviews.text: Received on time. It works perfectly fine after putting the AAA batteries in the back (you just want to make sure to place the two batteries in correct polarity). The display is bright and clear. Overall, the unit looks pleasant and work fine. The only one thing I wish that it comes with batteries included, which is not for this unit. Some other manufacturers do include the batteries in their unit to make it work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Phan

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend and would not order again except for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Since I have had similar products for years, I did not have trouble figuring out what to do but there were no markings or instructions or any way to tell how to place the batteries. I had to try every possible combination and finally got it right. Usually there is a + or a - sign to show you how the batteries go in. There was no such thing in this model. However, it was so much cheaper than I am used to paying of an oximeter that I would probably buy again, unless it quits on me soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am a Healthcare worker and use this in my work. It performs well. The only reason that I'm only giving 4 stars is that the cover won't stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consistency/accuracy is better than many
customer_reviews.text: During these pandemic times I’ve gotten a few of oximeters and several read low, such as 93-95%. I then read an NIH (National Institute of Health) article in which various brands of oximeters were tested and, sure enough, many oximeters fall we’ll short of accuracy. Why have one if it’s not useful? The Contec brand came up favorably and this model was of the same type so I got it. Indeed it reads very consistently as I try it with different members of my family. If you’re going to get an oximeter, I recommend getting this one. I didn’t care much about the price but this one also comes in at a lower price than the less accurate ones.
customer_reviews.author: The Fishers

customer_reviews.title: Came in USED
customer_reviews.text: Product clearly came used, though the listing doesn't say it is. Missing the pouch, dirty screen. Normally not a huge deal but I didn't want to be touching a USED product in these times. If I had known, I would have ordered a different one. Also, doesn't include batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I lost my last Oximeter so I decided to go less expensive this time. The feel of this is cheap, which it was and I could live with that if it gave accurate readings. To test it, several times I would put it on and let it register then let it turn off and put it back on and let it register. I’ve tried this many times and in the course of about 90 seconds I got readings that were 48, 117 and 70. That’s just one example of the crazy readings. This unit simply can’t be trusted. I’m thinking this unit was wired incorrectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement. Dose the job. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: mamaw of 8 + 1

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a lung disease and I need to keep track of my O2 stat level. This is easy to use and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Sommerfleldt

customer_reviews.title: Could save your life
customer_reviews.text: It is designed to be used by exercisers, but great for persons with breathing problems, to keep tabs on the oxygen level in your blood.
customer_reviews.author: theheadliner

customer_reviews.title: Does everything needed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for my husband who keeps losing his oxygen monitors. This works as well as, if not better than the more expensive models and includes the same extras. Since it is so expensive will buy another as back up!
customer_reviews.author: C C Odoms

customer_reviews.title: Oxygen/rate monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Has a hard time getting a reading, heart rate reading starts hi and drops over a minute to be stable. Other similar units at doctor's don't do that. Often doesn't get a reading and I just switch fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: As a retired medic, I cannot say enough about these. And for the price, well it works flawlessly. You will need two triple ( AAA) batteries
customer_reviews.author: Claude McClain

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Useful product and a fabulous value. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: E.penname

customer_reviews.title: used item that doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Came scratched and obviously used. Does not read at all. Waste of money do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: goatface

customer_reviews.title: This Pulse Oximeter is a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I used this Pulse Oximeter when I went to Colorado. I wanted to know how the altitude affected me in my ability to breath normally. It also helped me to see what my pulse was.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia M Azores

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and very accurate. At one point I was in an ambulance with the professional test on and then I compared with my test, and there is negligible difference (rate of change difference but same numbers)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Low cost and seems to work.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be everything it is advertised for. A bit more bulk than I expected, but I think this is mostly due to 2 AAA batteries. This should be quite handy for patient monitoring during my duties as a Ski Patroller. It is simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my smaller fingers but my husband’s larger hands it will not read.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Self Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a oximeter on Friday 08/02/2019 and feel good that I found it at my doorstep. I feel good about amazons fast delivery and available of low price product. I now can monitor myself when I run to know if there are any problems with my pulse rate.
customer_reviews.author: Jeddy E. West

customer_reviews.title: Really handy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to make sure my oxygen level is correct.
customer_reviews.author: Helen B. Campanella

customer_reviews.title: Very close to accuracy of a hospital oximeter
customer_reviews.text: Them item arrived before I was discharged from the hospital, so I was able to see how accurate the oximeter was. The values on this oximeter to the hospital’s was off by only 1-2 numbers. For example the hospitals oximeter was 94, where this oximeter read 92-93.
customer_reviews.author: E. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Tell the right pulse rate
customer_reviews.text: febreeze! Love how it takes the right pulse rate my pulse is always hi so I like to keep track
customer_reviews.author: Shirley P.

customer_reviews.title: Valuable device
customer_reviews.text: This is a quick and easy way to check blood oxygen level
customer_reviews.author: David Tortorano

customer_reviews.title: AAA batteries are required.
customer_reviews.text: They don't look like they will fit, but they do. The polarity is not well marked, but the batteries go in two directions.
customer_reviews.author: RLouis Oueinaught

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Does not give accurate results when compared with pulse ox at physician's office. Does not good if cannot depend on accurate results.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: It is useful to have in the house with a small kid!
customer_reviews.author: Xuan Ta

customer_reviews.title: So cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: This pulse oximeter is made from a very thin plastic case. And the battery compartment was misaligned, showing that both batteries would be inserted in the same direction. I returned the one I ordered. It was definitely NOT WORTH THE LISTED PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Colley-Bartley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the dollars!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for important readings. I got 3 to keep around different areas of the house. They all meter the same. Didn't come with aaa batteries but the battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: RochelleWhaley

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: checked against other devices and seems to be as accurate (or inaccurate) as other devices
customer_reviews.author: Ted B. Moss

customer_reviews.title: used and damaged!
customer_reviews.text: Please check the reviews before considering. This vendor is sending people USED machines. My reader was completely warn and the back does not stay on at all. Very obvious that this is not new.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: I have another type which cost over twice as much as this item and they both work equally well. Just to be on the safe side, the next time you see your health care provider, take this along and compare it to their medical level meter so you can judge the accuracy of yours. I have purchase two of these and delivery was fast and both meters work equally well.
customer_reviews.author: SilverFoxDan

customer_reviews.title: First time user, good so far
customer_reviews.text: First time using this kind of equipment so I can’t compare with another one. Nonetheless, it came as the description, work well so far, It’s light weight, I like I can see the numbers Although I was really expecting it come with the batteries, you want to use your product right away. I’ll made another review as time pass
customer_reviews.author: donato p.

customer_reviews.title: Got Pulse?
customer_reviews.text: This is a devise we have to have in our household. it seems to be very accurate thus far. It also seems to be well made and would handle a drop or two with no issues ( not that I would drop it). Super simple to use and has an auto off feature that comes in very handy to save battery life. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EthanAndLiamHD

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it did not work at all. Tried 2 sets of bran new batteries and still nothing. Of course I had given it to my daughter and by the time she told me about it ... to late to return it . Oh well
customer_reviews.author: Carole Gee

customer_reviews.title: This doesn
customer_reviews.text: I've struggled to get working but have had no luck. I made sure the batteries are working by putting them in another device and was successful with that device but not this one. I don't know if it even pays to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Girden

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This little number has been GREAT for telehealth appointments and just tracking our vitals, in general. I bought one for my mom, as well. I today's circumstances, it's good to know your oxygen saturation and be able to determine if it waivers, especially if you have lung issues.
customer_reviews.author: PositiveOutlook

customer_reviews.title: Doenst work
customer_reviews.text: Tries on all fingers and still no reading. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Make-Up Queen

customer_reviews.title: great device
customer_reviews.text: My husband had an episode last week, his lips turned blue and he almost passed out, that is why we ordered this! Easy to use, great value!
customer_reviews.author: sueb

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work just fine.. the rubber cover didn't want to stay on but works fine without it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Possibility  to  change a defective item.
customer_reviews.text: Good afternoon. On May, 2019, I was by my daughter's house in Chicago and I did some purchases including 6 Contec Oximeters. One of them came defective, without the metal plaque in which the batteries are attached. I wanna know, if it's still possible for you to change this item. What should I do? Ask my daughter to send it to you? I'm in Brazil but one of her friends is here and I could send it through her. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rosana Zolini

customer_reviews.title: didnt work
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it to work I put in new stronger batteries and still will not work.. taking with me to Dr office and see if they can get it set
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Houchin

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: As a severe asthmatic, this gives device gives me the exact information I need to determine my treatment!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Defective!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived and the box was damaged - looks like it was crushed, and to my disappointment the pulse oximeter did not work. Initially, it would light up when batteries were placed inside but when the battery compartment cover was attached it stopped working. I tried repeatedly but it just kept shutting down.
customer_reviews.author: Thinking Out Loud

customer_reviews.title: Friendly, speedy,  accurate,  good quality  priced right.
customer_reviews.text: Received it today, thank goodness, I get winded with activity and this little machine tells me how bad I need to get on my oxygen after moving around. Thank you. Couldn't even find these at medical supplies or Walmart under 43.00 and up. Amazon is my store. I come here first.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality and pretty accurate. I expecially like the lanyard. The package was on time and came in this little box with everything described in it. Package does not come with batteries, you'll need two AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: dess

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for 8 months now, and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Saundra H.

customer_reviews.title: Good oximeter
customer_reviews.text: In the recent days we need to be more careful about our health due this pandemic. When I'm in search of oximeter I found this product in Amazon. It's easy to use, has a clear read-out of both the percentage of oxygen your blood is holding but also your pulse. I was very pleased to find this in stock, as these things are in shortage these days. I'm using this from last couple of days I would certainly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Just fine.  Cheap Product for the small price
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I did know back of my mind this will be just as good as the price paid. And it is true. It does read. Needs full charged batteries. Polarity directions are really confusing. You need to literally put a lot of pressure to insert the batteries. First of all , this is so fragile and pushing the batteries a couple of times...would mean i should come to amazon again....for a better quality stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Lolita Rasquinha

customer_reviews.title: I works but I have to remove the battery cover
customer_reviews.text: If I try to use it the way it should be, it does not work. So, I have to remove the cover of the battery and move the batteries a little bit. Then, it activates the contact and works.
customer_reviews.author: Francesco Sullo

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to read
customer_reviews.text: This is a convenient and easy to read device. Sometimes it is necessary to reposition the finger to get a reading. I checked it against the reading at the doctor's office, and the reading were the same.
customer_reviews.author: 3 no 7

customer_reviews.title: Only works on certain fingers
customer_reviews.text: Put batteries in the unit and tried multiple times to get it to work using my index finger. small red lights would come on briefly and then turn off. Finally tried it on my pinkey and it appeared to work. However the flakiness of the device makes me question the accuracy. Tried it on my wife and it only read on her index finger. Will be ordering a different device and returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 95 yr old WW I l Veteran having heart issues with O2 level concerns: His lovely Bride Mentioned how much having this device gives them piece of mind when he’s not wanting to have to use his oxygen around his home! So I say try it !!
customer_reviews.author: deb rojas

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Accurate. Bad battery cover
customer_reviews.text: This pulse oximeter works as promised, and it’s easy & accurate. However, after only 40 days of use without ever dropping or impacting, the back battery cover will not clamp tight, and keeps falling off each time we lift the unit for another use. We ordered a replacement, and hopefully the new unit’s back cover will remain secure.
customer_reviews.author: Chakra Earthsong

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for a few days now, but it is working just fine. It is easy to read and doesn't need technical abilities to use it! Great for my aging mother who is on oxygen and checks her pulse ox periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Happy pandemic customer!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a staple part of our daily routine during this pandemic. I have felt much less anxiety daily taking our temperature and using this device to track whether we have symptoms. Without it, I don’t feel I could know whether our lungs are in trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Mom approved
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my mom who needed a monitor for her oxygen level & heart rate.For the price it's great. She loves it. Compact & can carry it in her purse or pocket. It's been a true helper for her when her conditions change. We both recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rex

customer_reviews.title: It reads very clearly
customer_reviews.text: I like the meter bcuz u can press it without hurting ur finger with pressure
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine I.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: The oximeter appears to be all as advertised. Time will tell to determine accuracy, but craftsmanship is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When you turn it around the scream don’t move with it like my neighbors does
customer_reviews.text: It works fine just can’t turn my finger around to read it
customer_reviews.author: Kenny C

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was suspicious about how accurate my health app was with my oxygen levels and it matches up with this meter and matches my heart rate as well. It's great and came with a little pouch to keep in.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, inaccurate readings.
customer_reviews.text: The device reads as unstable and inaccurate. It would jump all over from 95% to 89% to all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: USER

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery works well light weight and easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: Ruby G

customer_reviews.title: Contex fingertip pulse oxygenator
customer_reviews.text: This is great to keep up with my husbands oxygen level
customer_reviews.author: F H

customer_reviews.title: Not at all recommended--unusable
customer_reviews.text: I did not open this right away as I isolate delivered packages right now for a few days. By the time I did open it and try it, this product did not even turn on. Tried two different pair of batteries (none included) and nothing. Waste of money and I didn't want to have to go into a store to return it. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Pulse reader
customer_reviews.text: This item shipped fast, it is exactly as described, it has easy instructions with clear readings. The reading results appear fast. very nice item highly recommend to anyone who needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Celia  Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waster your money - inaccurate readings... my family of 7 used it and all below 80 and we are all healthy
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi64

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It takes a while longer to start getting a reading. You have to re-insert it or move it around the finger. An "ok" pulse oxymeter but I will buy another one that would get a reading faster.
customer_reviews.author: CVmom

customer_reviews.title: Average pulse ox, easy to read and use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read and use. I can only assume this is accurate because I have nothing to compare it to, but it seems to be similar to any other average pulse ox. Great for at-home use.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Martin

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Unhappy With Purchase! I have Asthma and I as a retired nurse both using Pulse Ox and having used on myself I know how it supposed to work and it doesn’t do both and often reads error. $$ costly
customer_reviews.author: jrsygal59

customer_reviews.title: This product
customer_reviews.text: I only Gave it a perfect score because I wanted My review to be posted. It fell apart after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony S.

customer_reviews.title: Okay a little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Use daily. Had a stroke. Need stats accurate. Doesn’t agree with BP machine. Off by 6 points most times. Checked it against Dr reading as well off a bit. Hard to read upside down for patient
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted at a price I was comfortable with!
customer_reviews.text: I use this oxometer to periodically check my mom's. O2 level because she has COPD. And I use it to check my heart rate when I'm working out. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Crissy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device to get a quick read on vitals. It's small, compact and very easy to use and read results. Be careful to install batteries exactly according to the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My mom needed this to monitor her oxygen level and it has helped so much. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: coco Arreola

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I’ve used it for over a year without any issues. I recommend checking accuracy often with other pulse oximetries if you are using it as I do in a fast paced medical office over a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: April F.

customer_reviews.title: Just what they use in my doctor's office
customer_reviews.text: Use this for a family member who is going through chemo therapy for cancer to monitor his oxygen absorption. Easy to use! Quick results!
customer_reviews.author: Nick in Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money or wait time to receive. Directions are not very clear. Readings will register some times and not register at other times.
customer_reviews.author: Tinag

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.text: I work in LTC and bought this to use on my elderly patients but it rarely works. I can use it on myself without issues but there are times when it just shuts off. I recommend spending a couple more dollars for a responsive one.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Does not give consistent readings
customer_reviews.text: The oximeter fails to read the oxygen even though the finger is in the device properly. It says finger out instead of registering the o2. I need an oximeter that consistently works right.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: No AA batteries included as manual indicates
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this item, and, as far as I know, it works. But the product appeared to be a return, with the plastic casing around the pulse oximeter in the box open, and no batteries, although there is what appears to be a compartment for them, as well as for the lanyard, and for the oximeter. Maybe this is what $30.00 USD gets you.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great value, quality & accurate
customer_reviews.text: Great product I thought I was buying "No frills pulse ox" but got a quality product w bag & strap.
customer_reviews.author: V Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Came without batteries. Cheaply made. At trying to place batteries, one end flew out, had to crawl on knees to locate. Too much packaging, very flimsy. Wont know how it performs til needed. Arrived on time, as promised.
customer_reviews.author: SmartShopper

customer_reviews.title: don't buy, spend more for a good unit
customer_reviews.text: I am returning. Press on battery compartment, powers off. Can't get an accurate reading. Its all over the place!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Darien

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is questionable at times. It will read different numbers on the same person,if you try it several times in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works, accurate
customer_reviews.text: Blught for mum to monitor O2 to get her off prescription oxygen. Works well, she likes it. Her Doctor approved it as accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan horticulturalist

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice and now it won't even turn on !! Would not recommended buying !!!
customer_reviews.author: FLG

customer_reviews.title: Left outside during rain in envelope which was not ater resistant
customer_reviews.text: Items left in front door, which is not mistake by driver, but envelope is not water resistant and product was soaked...rendering it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Sukica

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works well for not much cash. Easy to use, just put it on your finger and it does it’s job quickly. Not much more to it than that. Simple and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Blood Oxygen and Pulse Meter
customer_reviews.text: I primarily used this for Pulse when I exercise. Handy and fast. rugged enough for exercise and jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: It is seemingly accurate and easy to use. I'm a new nurse graduate and bought this one for home use and am pleased with it. It was a good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work. I tried multiple brands of new batteries and it did not even turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok nothing to brag about
customer_reviews.text: You have to read it upside down. You have to wait a minute or two before it actually starts working.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as my Dr's. She's going to buy a couple!
customer_reviews.author: Melonie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I work in a doctor office and we needed an extra. I use this one more than the one the office has, it gets used multiple times a day 5 days a week and works great. Shuts off quickly once finger is removed.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: While I saw many units that were more than twice the price, they all seemed to be pretty much the same. After receiving and using this unit, I'm glad that I chose this one as ut works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: RenoPete

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive monitor for Corona lower H2O levels in blood
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be good to have around to check for reduced h20 levels associated with corona.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pulse oximeter! For the price it is everything I need and more! I am a First Responder and I would most definitely trust this enough to use on my patients. It is quick and seems to be reliable. Not to mention the battery life is really good too! I would most definitely recommend this product to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Hendelman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good item, good price. Easy to use it at work.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Perales Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly as advertised. Very easy to use and simple design.
customer_reviews.author: CBabler

customer_reviews.title: Always consult your physician.
customer_reviews.text: Seems accurate. Might be more useful if they put what your ideal pulse and heart rate should be.
customer_reviews.author: NANCY VALENTINE

product_meta.title: CONTEC CMS50M Fingertip Pulse Oximeter Blood Oxygen Saturation Monitor with lanyard blue white color
feature_bullets: Small in volume、light in weight and convenient in carrying.With Pulse rate value display, bar graph display.

It is gospel for health sports lovers.People who interested in measuring their SpO2 and pulse rate.Such as skiers, bikers,climbers and so on. We recommend to test your blood oxygen levels after doing sports.

This Pulse Oximeter is a portable equipment adopting advanced technology, it mainly checks SpO2 and PR value through the finger, which provides advanced, non-invasive and scientific means for quantitative measurement of oxygen saturation. It is applicable for use in plateau area, community healthcare, oxygen bar, Fitness clubs, physical training room and family, etc.
Contents in the package: Main unit,FREE Lanyard,User manual.Please note:There's no batteries in the package.
